capability_questions.question: Prepare Provider Payment Capability Question Is the process primarily manual or automatic? use standards in the process? process?

levels.level_1: paper-based activity to accomplish tasks. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: automatic processes to accomplish tasks. SMA applies a mix of HIPAA and state- specific standards. SMA collaborates with other agencies and entities to adopt HIPAA standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions. Prepare Provider Payment
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for intrastate exchange of information. SMA collaborates with other intrastate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable business services.
levels.level_4: extent possible across the interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for clinical and interstate information exchange. SMA collaborates with other interstate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable processes including clinical Level 4 & 5 information.
levels.level_5: extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for national exchange of information. SMA collaborates with agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that maximize automation of routine operations.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Timeliness of Process
capability_questions.question: How timely is the end-to-end process?

levels.level_1: mandated requirements for timeliness (i.e., the process achieves results within the time specified by law or regulation). The process requires 30 or more business days to complete.
levels.level_2: use of automation. Timeliness exceeds legal requirements. Process completes within weeks, rather than months.
levels.level_3: collaboration, use of information sharing, standards, and regional information exchange hubs. Timeliness exceeds Level 2. The process takes fewer than 60 seconds to complete.
levels.level_4: available in near real time. Processes that use clinical information result in immediate action, response, and results. SMA has interstate interoperability, which further improves timeliness over Level 3.
levels.level_5: available in real time. Processes improve further through connectivity with other States and with federal agencies. Most processes execute at the point of service. Results are almost immediate.
